notes: Tested SKBitmap.Decode with multiple PNG types (16-bit RGB, 8-bit RGBA, 8-bit colormap/palette, large 2048x2048 gradient) across SkiaSharp 2.88.3, 3.119.2, and main source. All decodes succeeded on all versions and platforms (macOS ARM64 host + Docker Linux x64). Also tested edge cases: truncated PNGs at 10%/50%/90% and empty data — all behaved correctly. The reporter's specific PNG file (image1.png) was never attached to the issue, making it impossible to reproduce the exact failure. The original #933/#1981 was a zlib SSE decompression bug fixed in 2.88.1. Without the reporter's specific image, we cannot determine whether their PNG triggers a different code path.

reproductionSteps.description: Create standalone console project with SkiaSharp 2.88.3 and copy test PNG files (baboon.png 16-bit RGB, color-wheel.png 8-bit RGBA, index8.png 8-bit colormap, testimage.png 8-bit RGBA)
reproductionSteps.command: mkdir -p /tmp/repro-2759 && cd /tmp/repro-2759 && dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.3

versionResults.notes: All 4 PNG types decoded successfully via SKBitmap.Decode(string), SKCodec.Create(stream), and SKBitmap.Decode(SKData). Edge cases (truncated, empty) handled correctly.
Generated PNGs (small/medium/large RGBA) and SKData decode all succeeded on Debian 12 x64.
All PNG types decoded successfully on latest stable release.
Ran 31 existing decode-related tests (SKBitmapTest + SKCodecTest) — 30 passed, 1 skipped (DownloadedStream, network-dependent).

artifacts.description: Reporter's PNG file that fails to decode. Never attached to the issue — this is the critical missing artifact preventing reproduction.

triageCorrections.upstream: Triage recommended requesting sample image (actionability: request-info, confidence 0.90)
triageCorrections.corrected: Confirmed: without the reporter's specific PNG file, the bug cannot be reproduced. All standard PNG types (16-bit RGB, 8-bit RGBA, 8-bit colormap, large gradient) and edge cases (truncated, empty) decode correctly across all tested versions and platforms (macOS ARM64, Docker Linux x64).

proposedResponse.body:
Thanks for reporting this! We attempted to reproduce the issue with SkiaSharp 2.88.3 (and 3.119.2) using multiple PNG types — 16-bit RGB, 8-bit RGBA, 8-bit colormap, and large gradient PNGs — on both macOS and Linux, but all decodes succeeded.

The original #933 / #1981 was traced to a zlib SSE decompression bug and fixed in v2.88.1. Since you're on 2.88.3+, your PNG may be triggering a different code path.

To help us investigate, could you:

1. **Attach the actual PNG file** (`image1.png`) — without it we can't reproduce the specific failure
2. **Run this diagnostic** to get the failure reason:
   ```csharp
   var codec = SKCodec.Create(@"C:\Temp\image1.png", out SKCodecResult result);
   Console.WriteLine($"Codec: {codec != null}, Result: {result}");
   ```
3. **Confirm your exact SkiaSharp version** — the issue body mentions 2.88.6 but the version field says 2.88.3

**Workarounds to try:**
- Re-save the PNG with Paint.NET or ImageMagick (this resolved #1981 for several reporters)
- Upgrade to SkiaSharp 3.119.2, which uses a significantly updated Skia engine

**Tested versions:**
| Version | Platform | Result |
|---------|----------|--------|
| 2.88.3 | macOS ARM64 | ✅ All PNGs decoded |
| 2.88.3 | Linux x64 (Docker) | ✅ All PNGs decoded |
| 3.119.2 | macOS ARM64 | ✅ All PNGs decoded |
| main (source) | macOS ARM64 | ✅ 30/30 decode tests passed |
proposedResponse.summary: Cannot reproduce — requesting the specific PNG file and diagnostic output

actionability.reason: Cannot reproduce without the reporter's specific PNG file. All standard PNG types decode correctly on 2.88.3, 3.119.2, and main across macOS and Linux. The original #933/#1981 zlib fix was in 2.88.1, so either this is a different PNG-specific issue or the reporter's version info is inaccurate.

workarounds: Re-save the PNG with a different tool (Paint.NET, ImageMagick) to re-encode with standard compression
Use SKCodec.Create(filename, out SKCodecResult result) to get the specific failure reason
Try SKImage.FromEncodedData() as an alternative decode path
Upgrade to SkiaSharp 3.119.2 which uses a significantly newer Skia engine

actions.description: Link to #1981 (parent issue with zlib fix) — same symptom, different root cause suspected
Link to #2429 (similar SKBitmap.Decode returns null symptom on a different image)
